Posted By: Pantheon (2/4/2012 9:50:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think it's worth noting that this triggers on your opponent's upkeep as well, which could give it some use providing quick blockers. Combining with some ETB effects make it not so bad at the very least.  
  
Of course, throw in some [Swiftfoot Boots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swiftfoot Boots) or [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) and this card becomes much more interesting. Slamming into an enemy with two titan effects in a turn can be pretty devastating. The lack of permanence means it's no alternative to [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites), but I can see this being a lot of fun in a casual deck. Filling your GY with fatties then bouncing them onto the battlefield for nothing means you've got more free mana to spend on other stuff each turn (like getting even more fatties into your GY).   
  
@pdbdbomb  
You don't pay to cast any of the creatures. You just exile the card and get a token copy of it.  
  
@Vogie  
  
Woops, my bad. Still, wouldn't say this really breaks birthing pod any more than say, undying does.  
... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: lyysander (2/23/2012 8:47:43 PM)

posts.post_content:
This card is broken. Buy em while they're cheap.
  
   
Blue and black (and even green with [Mulch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mulch), [Splinterfright](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinterfright), etc.) have no problems getting creatures into their owner's graveyard. So, on ***turn four*** with this out I will be able to cast a [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan) (or any other creature with an awesome 'comes into play' ability) ... for free, mind you... on my opponent's next turn. That's basically skipping 2 turns when my opponent gets his fourth turn. And nevermind the fact that on my fifth turn, (using the [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan) example again) I can basically cast ***2 more*** for only 6 CMC total. Not to even mention the fact I'm taking a turn on my opponent's turn, which is basically a built-in [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk) each turn.
  
   
This screams card advantage, turn skipping, counterspell dodging and whatever else... for only 4 mana! Just remember how quickly that spell that put enchantments fr... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: nirvava (2/23/2012 11:49:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is one of those sneaky powerful enchantments. No it's not easy to build around, but when you start getting 2 free creature based effects every turn it can be quite powerful. Deceptively powerful with splicers, great in sacrifice decks (Vish-Kal EDH comes to mind)  
  
  
And don't underestimate what this card can do in a straight up mill yourself/reanimator build. Reanimating Elesh Norn or Sheoldred, and copying it with Cackling Counterpart. Of course this allows much more flexibility than its blue counterpart. [Back from the Brink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Back from the Brink).
posts.html:

And don't underestimate what this card can do in a straight up mill yourself/reanimator build. Reanimating Elesh Norn or Sheoldred, and copying it with Cackling Counterpart. Of course this allows much more flexibility than its blue counterpart. Back from the Brink.

Posted By: Enemy_Tricolor (3/17/2012 10:58:22 PM)

posts.post_content:
This card seems like it should get some more respect. It would work wonders in a deck based around the White / Black "**Dark Sacrifice**" theme in ***Dark Ascension***. It also allows you to give **[Archdemon of Greed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archdemon of Greed)** a second helping of every human you have sacrificed to him, saving you from his big backlash if you are running low on humans in the battlefield... **[Disciple of Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disciple of Griselbrand)**, **[Skirsdag Flayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirsdag Flayer)**, and **[Falkenrath Torturer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Falkenrath Torturer)** also have a fairly good synergy with **[Seance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seance)** for the ***Innistrad*** block.  
  
This was my first post on Gatherer. I am not exactly sure how to make the mana symbols, so if anyone could help me out with that, I would greatly appreciate it. Thanks in advance.

posts.post_content:
I have to say, this with [Parallel Lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parallel Lives) and [Feed the Pack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feed the Pack) in a Green/White Token Deck using [Geist-Honored Monk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geist-Honored Monk)? Allow me to paint a picture:  
  
Up through turn two you cast your cheap cards ([Signal Pest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Signal Pest), [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) and [Accorder Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Accorder Paladin) come to mind) and this on turn three. Cast [Parallel Lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parallel Lives) on turn four. Turn five you cast the [Geist-Honored Monk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geist-Honored Monk), which at this point will be pretty monstrous if your board hasn't been eaten. Turn six is Feed the Pack, and after that you can sacrifice the monk, [Séance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Séance) it back in on your opponent's upkeep, and put a whopping EIGHT Permanent 1/1 Fliers onto the field thanks to the monk's "enter the battlefield" effect and two massive monks for blockers, not to mention all the wolf tokens you just spawned.  
  
And all of that is only if you really need it. With just about any to... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
